results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Morwell veterans]
results.brief_description: Ten Victorian veterans from Morwell tell stories of their time of service, providing their unique perspectives on army life, wartime and coming home to Australia. Produced with the assistance of Morwell RSL and the students of Kurnai College, Morwell.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.brief_description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.

results.description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [April 2010]
results.creator_credit: Reginald Relf, Ralph Basson, John Vincent, Jack Holdsworth, Hugh Melville, Grant Coultman-Smith, Gordon White, Con Bell, Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their service during various wars for Australia. Covering World War II and the Vietnam War, these men share their experiences, joys and traumas of this time that would shape the rest of their lives. Created as part of ‘In our words : stories from Victorian veterans’ Digital Storytelling project at ACMI.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [April 2010]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reginald Relf, Ralph Basson, John Vincent, Jack Holdsworth, Hugh Melville, Grant Coultman-Smith, Gordon White, Con Bell, Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their service during various wars for Australia. Covering World War II and the Vietnam War, these men share their experiences, joys and traumas of this time that would shape the rest of their lives. Created as part of ‘In our words : stories from Victorian veterans’ Digital Storytelling project at ACMI.
description_for_label: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their service during various wars for Australia. Covering World War II and the Vietnam War, these men share their experiences, joys and traumas of this time that would shape the rest of their lives. Created as part of ‘In our words : stories from Victorian veterans’ Digital Storytelling project at ACMI.

results.title: In our water
results.brief_description: South Brunswick, New Jersey; Spring, 1975. Frank Kaler and his family are convinced there is something wrong with their water; vegetables cooked in it change colour, skin lesions appear after bathing in it. The health department claims that it is drinkable, but it is later determined to be some of the most toxic drinking water in the country.
results.description: South Brunswick, New Jersey; Spring, 1975. Frank Kaler and his family are convinced there is something wrong with their water; vegetables cooked in it change colour, skin lesions appear after bathing in it. results.title: In our own time
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Bauman and Educational Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art of the western world”.
An episode in the comprehensive art history series, “Art of the Western World”, that focuses on art work from the Abstract Impressionists to the Pop artists of the 21st century. Narrated by Michael Wood, this program focuses on the works of such artists as Jackson Pollock, Andy Warhol, Roy Lichtenstein and Klaus Oldenburg, tracing the progression of New York as a centre for the visual arts and the development of Pop Art. Through a discussion of the works in their historical, intellectual and social context, this program provides both a thorough outline of these periods in art history and underlines their relevance to issues outside the parameters of the works themselves.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Art of the western world”.

Through a discussion of the works in their historical, intellectual and social context, this program provides both a thorough outline of these periods in art history and underlines their relevance to issues outside the parameters of the works themselves.
